definition: to add/to attach/to be close to/to be attached
body/life/oneself/personally/one's morality and conduct/the main part of a structure or body/pregnant/classifier for sets of clothes: suit, twinset/Kangxi radical 158

sentences.english: The Gospel is clear on that, too. Woe to you on whom the evil demons act.
sentences.chinese: 福音书上很清楚，对那些被魔鬼附身的表述悲哀吧。

sentences.english: Right to cast a spells not successful, be possessed and sounded a warning to mirrors.
sentences.chinese: 权氏没有下咒成功，被附身并向宝镜发出了警告。

sentences.english: They believed she was possessed by devils.
sentences.chinese: 他们认为她是被魔鬼附身了。

sentences.english: Ann: Yes, his friends thought he might be possessed by a fiend.
sentences.chinese: 是的，他的朋友都认为他被魔鬼附身。

sentences.english: A:  I think that kid is possessed.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得那孩子被附身了。

sentences.english: The natives thought the explorer was possessed by a fiend.
sentences.chinese: 当地人认为探险家被恶魔附身了。

sentences.english: We take possession each other to remember that only then like this pesters to not stops.
sentences.chinese: 我们附身彼此记忆，才这样纠缠到无止尽。

sentences.english: And what kind of spell is mankind under?
sentences.chinese: 人类究竟被施了怎样的咒语，被什么邪灵附身？

definition: (of a spirit or deity) to possess sb
the real body (of Buddha or a God)/true effigy
ghost/demon/terrible/damnable/clever/sly/crafty/(suffix for sb with a certain vice or addiction etc)/one of the 28 constellations
lit. reincarnated in sb else's body (idiom); fig. a discarded or discredited idea returns in another guise
to spare time for a separate task/doppelgänger/sockpuppet (Internet slang)
